concept.title: Sections and examples
concept.shortdesc: Sections and examples can be contained only by the body of a topic. They cannot nest. They can contain block-level elements like paragraphs, phrase-level elements like API names, or text.

conbody.p: Sections are non-nesting subheadings within a topic. You can also use them to create untitled groupings of text for reuse. If you need nested subheadings, don't use sections - nest your topics instead.

The <section> element isn't allowed in tasks. In concepts, use sections for content that requires a title but that isn't significant enough to stand on its own as a topic. In reference topics, use sections for repeating headings like Usage that don't constitute a new topic in themselves, just a partition of the current topic.
Examples are a special kind of section. They take the same kind of content, and look the same on output, but are marked as examples for the sake of XML-aware search and filtering.
The <example> element is allowed in all information types. Typically an example would contain such things as <codeblock> elements, or images showing possible settings for a configuration pane.
